summary:
Stephen has gained over 19 years of experience in the area of Business Analysis, attained at Tier 1 financial services companies and one of the big 4 consulting firms.  Stephen has a broad range of experience, covering requirements management, strategic reviews, change management, information integration and solution delivery.  Stephen has significant experience representing the business for new processes and technology engagements ensuring delivery of real business value.  

- Lead and facilitate business stakeholder workshops to identify and prioritise requirements and concerns as well as understanding the environments they operate in
- Strong project management skills, with over 6 years of experience working in Agile Scrum delivery and SDLC environments, including using JIRA and Confluence
- Strong stakeholder management - interacts with all levels of management, obtain buy in and sign off and manage expectations, demonstrating appropriate tools and techniques
- Documenting and maintaining procedures, processes and controls for all business requirements
- Analyse current state and future requirements, identify gaps, and map the transition
- Investigate large and complex data sets and propose options to remediate issues
- Experience of working with banking products including Mortgages, Credit Cards, Deposits  and Front Office systems
- Proficient with Advanced Excel, VB, SQL/Teradata and Microsoft Office

profile_positions.description:
Economic and Financial Statistics – Delivery of a large scale Axiom reporting solution to prepare and submit Regulatory Returns to a range of government agencies with significant process and data challenges.  The solution would be implemented over several releases with changes made to Balance Sheet returns, new lending returns - covering Mortgages, personal and business finance, stocks and flows with interest rates and cost of funds 

Achievements & Responsibilities
- Understanding new regulatory reporting requirements, delivering commercial interpretations and compiling business requirements
- Execution of detailed data analysis and results verification, with reconciliation to Oracle General Ledger and other regulatory reports
- Collaboration with a broad array of stakeholders and technical specialists to communicate and influence change
- Reporting of progress and status to relevant project managers, ensuring issues are properly documented and addressed
- Defined requirements and solution design in conjunction with business and technology teams
- Delivery of functional specifications and ad-hoc reporting as required by the program
profile_positions.title: Senior Finance Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Daily Liquidity Coverage Ratio project – Creation and delivery of a Liquidity Coverage Ratio on a daily basis and enhance the processes and tools of the Treasury team to manage the liquidity position of the group in times of liquidity stress.  Key activities include: Reengineering of existing monthly processes and integration of daily data from source systems.  Analysis of daily Undrawn data for all products and facilities offered by the Westpac group, to ensure all commitments are known and can be derived in a timely manner.  Development of a field mapping tool for use by other teams to verify data transformations.
 
ABS Securitisation project – Design and implementation of a Securitisation data model and interface to allow for the management and internal/external reporting of Asset Backed Securities.  Responsibilities include: Lead BA responsible for partnering with the key stakeholders (business and Treasury IT) to ensure all requirements surrounding the end to end process are clearly understood and appropriate, clear solutions are designed, documented and implemented.  Identifying gaps between what the RBA requires, and what the bank has, and taking the necessary steps to reduce or eliminate those gaps.  Implementation of a new ABS Securitisation management and reporting platform, integrated with the wider Treasury Data Mart.  
 
Independent Price Verification project – Replacement of existing process to source, calculate, validate and distribute over 100,000 rates via Excel spreadsheets (200+) and Access databases (20+)  with a vendor solution and internally built user interface.  Key activities include: Reverse engineering of existing process, documenting ‘as is’ process, detailed task planning and estimation.  Functional specifications for Back End sourcing and transformation of data, calculations and distribution to product and risk systems.
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Business Requirements Management project - development and implementation of a requirements management capability using industry aligned standards that would be integrated into the Bank’s existing frameworks.  Responsibilities include Investigation of existing processes, integration of IIBA processes with PMLC and SDLC. Review and development of new project deliverable templates to support BRM.  Delivery of training sessions to the BA community (over 1,200 BAs) and awareness sessions to identified project related roles (over 4,500)
Finance and Risk Architecture Program - working with the finance and risk teams to deliver a single source of data, from the source systems through the Group Data Warehouse, reporting layers to end user reports.  Key activities include Lead BA of the Metadata stream to develop and deploy a new enterprise wide solution.  Facilitated business stakeholders towards functional design decisions to re-engineer current processes to ensure they are efficient and business user friendly.  Review of finance data sources and identification of data elements and calculations
profile_positions.title: Senior Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Financial Consolidation and BI Reporting
Clients: Credit Suisse, Visa, Schroders Investment Bank, BAE Systems
Responsibilities included 
Engaging in the development of core applications working with client’s key stakeholders and system developers to ensure the systems meet business requirements
Gathering, managing and documenting business requirements for various financial driven reporting needs, whilst building and maintaining effective working relationships with the Business and IT Stakeholders
Supervised reporting teams in the build of BI reporting to meet the requirements of different business functions such as Marketing, Strategy, Financial Planning & Analysis and Treasury.

BI Finance Transformation
Client – Constellation
Key activities:
Conducted workshops with Finance teams to understand the current ‘as-is’ procedures and obvious areas of difficulty
Reviewed the existing reporting process including data analysis and mappings
Highlighted “Quick Wins” around systems, process and infrastructure which would enhance compliance, data integrity and reporting
Identified medium and longer term actions for Finance to improve the accuracy of its reporting, and streamline the planning process, including migration from Excel based reports to Hyperion reporting
Developed plan for integrating Finance into the Sales and Operations process, identifying data elements, transformations and timelines
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant
